interfaceFramework

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • interfaceFramework.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Game
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    The class checks collisions, imports and paints the Pac-Man and Ghost pictures into the Maze It also deals with the Pause and Resume and Pac-Man's movement
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor which sets the timer to 200 and starts it Calls invalidate and then adds this component's validateRoot to a list of components that need to be validated.
      void checkCollision()
      The method checks for potential collisions and impediments to the progress of the characters if there are impediments to the character's movement such as a wall or another character, this method changes the boolean ingame to false This boolean is then painted in using the aforementioned paint method
      static void endOfGame() 
      void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      this method, utilizing case statements, checks if pacman can move in the inputted direction, and then moves pacman accordingly

      void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e) 
      void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
      The method imports and paints the Pac-Man and Ghost pictures into the Maze.
      void pauseSession()
      The method creates the Pause for the game using p It uses a stopped timer to implement the Pause It also prints "There is a problem" if an exception is found
      void resumeSession()
      The method is the one that resumes game using the r keypress It starts the timer stopped by the pauseSession method It also prints "There is a problem" if an exception is found

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Constructor which sets the timer to 200 and starts it Calls invalidate and then adds this component's validateRoot to a list of components that need to be validated. Validation will occur after all currently pending events have been dispatched. In other words after this method is called, the first validateRoot (if any) found when walking up the containment hierarchy of this component will be validated. Also Repaints this component.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        The method imports and paints the Pac-Man and Ghost pictures into the Maze. It paints the map that is created in the Map class It paints a different picture of Pac-Man depending on the direction in which Pac-Man is going Finally, it moves Pac-Man and Ghost based on the results of the checkCollision method
        Overrides:
        paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - an object of Graphics

      • checkCollision

        public void checkCollision()
        The method checks for potential collisions and impediments to the progress of the characters if there are impediments to the character's movement such as a wall or another character, this method changes the boolean ingame to false This boolean is then painted in using the aforementioned paint method

      • pauseSession

        public void pauseSession()
        The method creates the Pause for the game using p It uses a stopped timer to implement the Pause It also prints "There is a problem" if an exception is found

      • resumeSession

        public void resumeSession()
        The method is the one that resumes game using the r keypress It starts the timer stopped by the pauseSession method It also prints "There is a problem" if an exception is found

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        this method, utilizing case statements, checks if pacman can move in the inputted direction, and then moves pacman accordingly
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e - takes the keystroke of the player as a parameter
